column4: that's assuming you have an old dos boot disk with dos fdisk on it...
right... which is why i said assuming you have a dos boot disk... most people don't these days... especially if they got a computer that came with XP
i'm assuming that guy has one, because he mentioned it
i don't know how people get by without floppies. boot disks, bios flashes, emergencies.. it's so handy, and they sell for less than $10, how can you afford not to?
they are 20 year old obsolete piles of crap... I wrote a disk driver for them once and man that hardware sucks... what do you need it for when you have cds?
can you do a bios flash from cdrom?
just burn a bootable cd using the floppy disk image
what about on older machines that don't boot to cds?
older than what?  6 years?  throw them away ;)
what about.. umm.. yeah. it's frickin $10, and it comes in handy! that's more than i can say about other computer peripherals and devices.
i have 2 floppy drives, no cds, i LOVE floppies
kidding :P i have 1 and use it once a month or so
of course... any actual msdos image you download is an illegal pirated copy ;)
